text: Took an after market radio there to be installed in place of another after market radio already installed. The owner himself installed it and he did it in less than 15 minutes. Great deal right? Wrong. I already had a back up camera installed and hooked up to the old system. Dude didn't hook up the wires of the back up camera to the new system he installed. I was in a rush so left and came back another day. Dude tells me the new system didn't have an back up camera input. Yea Right. I wouldn't have bought the system if that was the case. I take it to an Audio shop that I use all the time to get all my stuff installed including the other after market radio that was replaced by the new one. They call me to the back and show me where the wires where just thrown in the back of the dash versus using just 1 cable tie and where on the back of the system, it clearly has a wire and and input that says CAM. Not to mention they gave me a dash kit that fit the radio so you can't see the gap between the head unit and the dash board. I've gotten a lot of cars tinted here by other workers, but never had the manager himself work on my car and never got electronics installed here and will never again. How you own a shop but your workers do a better job than you? Hope ya enjoy that over priced $ 75 cux it's the last dime you getting outta me.

name: Patrick Facchine
text:
DON'T GO HERE!!! GO ANYWHERE ELSE! !

If you don't feel like reading the entire review I understand so the short version is this.
My truck left there worse than it went in and I paid them almost $300 to do that. Lights now don't work, instrument lights don't work, if I turn the AC on after starting the truck it resets the audio system. Wires hanging, trash left in the truck and really, REALLY poor service and lack of respect. When I told the owner about the problems and that I simply wanted a refund for labor only  because I don't feel comfortable letting them back into my wiring he said "good luck bro! Try and get your money back and I'll sue YOU!".
I never want back because after checking the receipt it clearly says no refunds which makes sense when you do work like this.

The quality of workmanship AND professionalism was and still is the worst I've ever encountered.
I have NEVER written a review and I'm 30 years old and have dealt a lot in business. The fact that I'm writing this review is an extreme for me.

The stereo system they " installed " for me is very cut and dry.  I supplied the head unit, subwoofer and amp for '02 Tahoe. When I called to make an appointment they said come in first thing Monday (I called on Friday ) and this wasn't a problem for me.
When I called Monday morning to find out why my fiance was waiting in the parking lot for 45 minutes just to see someone they told me they're audio guy doesn't work Mondays but "they'll make it work".
After 4 hours of "installing" she finally left. When I got home from work and inspected the work I found the following:

1) Wires freely hanging run across my pedals.
2) The sub and amp were installed on the wrong side of the vehicle after being told 5 times and told to 3 different employees where to put it. I even set it up on the side I wanted it on and they put it opposite.
3) I was told they tune the system before it leaves the shop. They're " tuning " involved them turning everything to the maximum capacity and leaving it. Dangerous to any electronics.
4) They didn't have the materials needed to do a professional installation on my head unit (which is a $650 Kenwood double din) so I still have spaces beside the unit and looks like ass and nothing like a factory install like they assured me it would.
6) Left trash wire and clippings all through out my truck. When I mentioned this the OWNER told me "there was already trash there." There wasn't. I keep a clean truck. And when I mentioned the poorly ran wiring he told me it couldn't be because he did the wiring HIMSELF! !

I could list more but you get the idea and as I said I don't write reviews. Please take my advise and do not use this place. It's now costing me double to have someone else fix their handy work.

name: Mariah Eubank
text: Mark is very unpolite and unprofessional. I had power locks installed in my vehicle by him in 2014 (dealership referral). I have since had to have my locks serviced twice because they have stopped working. I called Mark back this week (Wednesday) because they stopped working for the THIRD time and he was extremely rude with me. When I called him to inform him about the locks having issues again his response was "Well I'm a one man team and I'm booked solid"... insinuating that he didn't want to assist me. I asked him when he had availability and he informed me to bring my vehicle in at 11am on Saturday and that he would "get to it by the end of the day". I'm not really sure why he couldn't have been more polite by simply saying "I have an opening this Saturday".   His negative attitude and poor customer service on the phone led me to seek someone else to take my car to. He then leaves a voicemail on my phone saying "You had an appointment at 3 and I never heard from you. I wish you had let us know because that appointment could have been given to someone else." I was informed to bring my car in at 11 and he would get to it, not that I had a 3pm appointment. His attitude is a sure way to LOSE A CUSTOMER and his work IS NOT SATISFACTORY.

name: Roxanna Duke
text:
My car radio system completely died on me, My father took my car to this "award winning" business to get a new one installed. They did a terrible job, the sound jumps from speaker to speaker all over my car. They CHEATED MY FATHER OUT OF $400 + DOLLARS. My two expert car friends said that the job could have been done for no more than $280. They took advantage of him and took his money. The person I spoke too on the phone to tell them of their lousy job was semi-rude to me. They said if I brought my car back in for them to fix what they did not do correctly, there would still be a charge, and that it would take 4+ hours to "strip and locate" a part in my car that my best friend found in 4 minutes. If this business is "award winning" then why did they do such a lousy job? Stop false advertising.

Do not use this company, they will do a terrible job, and CHEAT YOU OUT OF YOUR MONEY.  :-)

text: I don't know who or why 1 person would give Audio Creations a bad review but, in my opinion, they must be crazy! I shopped around and found Audio Creations to be VERY fair priced and customer accommodating. It was estimated to take about 2 1/2 hours to install my stereo, backup camera and associated devices. They gave me a "loaner" vehicle to use while they worked on my car. The installation is perfect. Sound is fantastic. Service outstanding. I'm a HAPPY customer.

text: Great place to get your car audio done. Mark really knows his stuff installed my whole system and tinted my windows. I am loving both the sound of the stereo is one of the best I have ever had and I have had a lot of systems over the years. Even had a problem with one of the speakers lost connection took it back and he had it fixed in a hour and did not charge me. Will definitely be going back when I need anything

name: Trevor Motes
text:
The guys there are great, had the guy build a custom box that did not even exist on the market for my '11 Silverado  (a single 12 ported box that only went under the 60 "of the 60/40 portion" of the flip seat). That way I still had some floorboard when I flipped up the 40 section of my rear seat. Anyways, he tuned  the port to the best frequency possible with what little airspace and volume I gave him. After a month, the sub finally broke in and got lower. Single Memphis 12 with Kenwood amp.

Fast forward 7-8 months later, I realized I had no bass, without diagnosing anything I dropped it off. They were slammed busy for that afternoon but didn't hesitate to diagnose and fix my problem. 30 minutes later I get the call that it's fixed. It was just a simple fix, the speaker cup had got a little hot and melted. They swapped it out no charge. Doesn't get any better than that in the car audio world. A somewhat custom job for a reasonable price, and they stand by their work.

name: Felix Marshall
text: I have known Mark from the very day he opened his business which went by Tint 'Em. I actually met his wife before I met him, although I'm not sure they were married or even acquainted that early on. I was in contract food service and she worked in a similar profession dealing with conventions and such. These are people of high moral character. Mark has done my window tinting, alarms, remote start feature, and some small bit of sound systems. I would like to tell you what you can experience from doing business with Mark, but it's much easier to tell you what you will not experience. With Mark's expertise, in his line of business, you can expect NOT to bring your vehicle back in a second time because of something that was not quite right. He is very conscientious about his work and takes pride in the job that he does although you will likely not see that side of him for his humble personality gets in the way of that. My oldest son is a die hard customer of Mark's but his thing is the sound systems in his vehicle. Whether it's me or my son, when we trade cars/SUV's, the first stop is Audio Creations. I have never considered his prices to be anything other than reasonable except for times when I've asked him if he is actually coming out ahead based on the charge. Never does he overcharge or do any unnecessary work. Here is a long story that I will attempt to give you the readers digest version. Some years ago, I bought a used suburban for my wife when she retired. A '99 suburban had a 40 gal gas tank & here is the significance of that. It had been very well kept up & as soon as we took possession from the individual the first stop was to see Mark. He pulled it in the shop & began work on the window tint, alarm, & remote start. A couple of days later when he finished, & went to start the truck & pull it out of the garage, it wouldn't start! What kind of electrical mistake had he made while installing the alarm & remote start? NONE!! Who would have thought a fuel pump would go out after the truck was pulled into the shop & the ignition cut off? That would not have occurred to anyone. Mark back tracked all the wiring to the point where the truck was before his work began. That took hours & hours, in fact days, but at that point we knew it was mechanical. I had the suburban towed from his shop to my auto mechanic, James Daniel, who by the way is just like Mark when it comes to excellence. He knew right away that on that long suburban with the 40 gal tank, it could be nothing else but a fuel pump. After replacing the fuel pump, it was back in Mark's hands to put the alarm system & remote start back in a second time & he asked for no additional charge. I did however pay him extra but not near enough to compensate for all the time & trouble that he went through. One last thing, I don't do business with anyone that I cannot establish a solid friendship with. Mark is my friend first, & my special, tech, tint, alarm, person second. He knows his stuff & you & your vehicle are in good hands with Mark. No one better.Very recently he even came to my house when I was out of town and my wife called him because my suburban, my Chevy Z truck, and even my Harley would not start. Before I left for my out of town trip I suspected I was having a problem with my alarm on our '04 suburban that he put in '09. It wasn't. In all three cases it was the batteries. He found my battery charger in the garage and got the suburban up and running so my wife was not stranded. His kindness in making a "House Call" given the circumstances was more than gracious. My wife had to twist his arm to get him to take even a small gratuity. This is the mark of CHARACTER!! This is MARK PICOGONA & Audio Creations.!!!! Let me close with a few words that are seldom heard these days, Trust, Integrity, and Ethical business practice. F. M.

name: Ryan McElroy
text:
I'd recently tried to install a new stereo head unit in my car. Long story short, after hours of effort and frustration, I decided to call Audio Creations to have a professional finish the job.

I arrived at around 5:50 (10 minutes before close) and Mark corrected my wiring mistakes. He also finished locking in the stereo and made sure it all was functioning correctly. Even with how quickly he worked, I'd showed up so close to closing that it was past 6:00 by the time it was finished.

Not only did Mark stay past close to fix my problem, he also refused to accept any payment! There's not a place in Birmingham I can think of that would do that, much less an establishment built on highly skilled labor like a car electronics and tinting shop.

There's no question that Audio Creations will be the first place I go to in Birmingham for my next sound system upgrade. These positive reviews are not a fluke - go here before anywhere else!

text: At first I would have gave 5 stars because they were friendly people they fit me in without an appointment. But then I few months after they installed my music it all started going out one speaker at a time until the point where no sound at all was coming out. So after that I decided to take matters into my own hands because I used to install music myself years ago. upon removing the panels from my doors an getting to the back of the speakers it was obvious that the wiring used on my speakers was very cheap because it had already dry rotted after a few months. I was able to get all my speakers back working again but then a few months after that they're already going back out only two of the speakers are working. so all-in-all I am not too happy about the job that was done on my vehicle.

resp.text:
Hi Mr. King.

Unless we're installing an amplifier or have reason to suspect that there is an issue with the wiring we just use the factory wire that's in the vehicle.

We also give you lifetime warranty on your labor. So if there was an issue you could have brought it back to us to check it out at no charge

text:
Had a remote start installed. Fast and friendly service, but I have to deduct for a couple reasons. It should be noted I have zero knowledge of remote start...

When I called to inquire, I asked what mfg/model they would use. I was told it could be 1 of 2, she wasnt sure which. That response could be improved I think.

After install, I was told it has a 12 minute run time. I have later read, it is programmed how the installer chooses. I would have liked to been given a choice for that time range.

I wasnt given any literature. (yes, it's online, but still)

The range on my Avital 4115L (turns out) is pretty weak. I'd say 100 ft maybe? Maybe that is standard, but I was a little disappointed in that.

That's it, felt inclined to share. Overall happy, 4 stars.

text: These are "GO TO PEOPLE" in the high end car audio business. My request to Wayne, David & Jimmy was to approach the sound quality of a Klipsch R-28F home speaker inside a Ram 1500 Quad cab pickup. No doubt a challenging task to pull off. They patiently experimented with different speaker combinations, speaker placements, and Equalizer settings. The final combination installed was 1ea. Metra audio processor, 1 ea. QBDODGEEQ110 sub box, 1 ea. JL10W6 sub, 4 ea. JL C1-690's without tweeters in doors. 2 ea. C5-653-XO crossovers, 2 ea. C5-400CM mid drivers, 2 ea. C5-075CT tweeters. Mid's & tweeters mounted in kick panels. Powered by JL HD900/5 amp. Hushmat sound deadening  installed in all doors. I'm very pleased with the price & sound quality of this system. I was treated like family here. I would highly recomend AVS to family & friends.

name: Jennifer Scheurich
text:
DO NOT USE UNLESS YOU CAN PAY BY CREDIT CARD!!!!
Approximately three weeks ago, our television stopped working.  The television was out of warranty just a few months and we had bought an extended warranty.  We called the extended warranty service and they directed us to Samsung the television manufacturer.  We were told that the only authorized service company was A/V video repair.

The first time that they came they asked for a check.  The technician helped my son get the television off of the wall and he identified the issue.  The technician then helped my son put the television back on the wall.
He left without providing a card, a receipt or any documentation indicating what the issue was. Since the technician came in a personal vehicle with no identifying signage, I had to call around town to identify who we had just given our check to.

In about a week (on a Monday), the company called to say that they had the part and again, the technician helped my son get the television off of the wall only to find out that they had misdiagnosed the problem.  I said at that time that there would not be any way of getting the television back down and that they needed to order the part and be back before the Thursday.  This information was not related to , or the company chose to ignore our request. At no time did the company status us, contact us to let us know that there was not going to be a way to fix the problem before the date we had stated.  Instead, they called on a Monday with the expectation that we would be there and that they needed to come on Wednesday.

When the technician showed up on Wednesday, I had to send them back because there was no one to take the television down. I said that we had specifically stated that there would not be anyone here to do this if they did not provide the service in a timely manner.

They left a message with me trying to arrange another time. I called back and explained that I was not happy with the level of service that we had so far been provided.  That in addition to not getting the right part, we needed to have someone come out with the technician to get the television off of the wall.  I felt that this was the least that they could do given the issues that they had in diagnosing the issue with the television.

At this time I was told that they could not guarantee that the next part that they had ordered would work and that the television had to be the floor in order to service it.  I stated that this was not an option.  They stated that they could simply send the part back.  I then requested to talk to a manager that said "The television has to be on the ground".  I then requested that the manager speak with my husband at which point the manager stated "Are you not capable of telling your husband what happened?"

When I stated that I was going to file a formal complaint with the better business  and angies list.  He said that I could call 1800 BBB, 1800 Angies list and 1800 I dont give a darned who you call.  At that point I hung up.

I have already called Samsung and they are putting me in touch with another more competent service center that will ensure that the diagnosis identified is correct.

name: Josh Waldeck
text:
The guys at Jimmy's are fantastic - I didn't want a fancy setup or any crazy speakers/subwoofers - I was just looking for a subtle smartphone enabled stereo for an 08 Acura.

They gave me the range of options available without being pushy to get me to buy some extravagant device. They knew my goal and helped me find an audio system that matched.

Ultimately, they did an outstanding job at installing a subtle double din Sony XAV AX5000. The integration looks OEM and the backup camera is extremely subtle with a crystal clear image. I was really worried about an aftermarket setup looking tacky, but these guys did a very professional job.

Highly recommend the team at Jimmy's. (before and after pics posted, along with the backup camera)

text: Great quality subs and audio equipment! They’ll meet all your car stereo needs. Fast install, great customer service, and just an over all great environment! Definitely will continue shopping with these guys

text: Fun working with these guys. They really help you in your decision to make a purchase. They explain the product you’re looking for and what would be the biggest bang for your bucks.  I’m looking forward to my next purchase because I will be back.

name: Kevin Wall
text:
These are the guys to use for all your car and marine stereo needs!!!!

Long story short: The marina that the Cobalt is stored at forces you to use their vendor. After a simple upgrade from factory set up I had multiple issues with the stereo system.

Took to the original marina I purchased the boat from to fix. Returned with a bill and bunch of excuses and no fix just a misdiagnosis.

Called the team from Jimmy's to sort out. They accommodated a time that worked for me to bring the boat in.

In a few short minutes had an initial diagnosis. Three short hours later they had fixed all issues and made the system work exactly as designed.

Extremely reasonable charge to perform the work!

If you need a stereo upgrade for your boat go here first!

If you are stuck at a marina with no way to get to them, talk to your marina manager to let the team at Jimmy's come to your boat. You'll be glad you did!

See you on the water!

name: Jerry Jackson

Answered all questions, did not try to Upsell me, and installation was clean.  Install took 15 minutes more than stated. No biggie. Will be back. Would recommend to a friend.

name: Leonard Hall
text:
I tried, on many occasions, to support this business. I went here in June and spoke with Ben about correcting an issue that was caused at another car audio place.

Ben assured me that it would be an easy fix and told me to come by the following week. I called one day that next week and Ben said that they were too busy on that particular day. I asked if I could just make an appointment instead. Ben said, “Well, I’m kinda tied up right now. Try us again later this week.”

I was in the area the following week so I went by. After greeting me, Ben remembered me and immediately told me that they couldn’t get to my car that day. I told him that I wasn’t expecting a same-day service. I, instead, wanted to make an appointment. Ben thanked me for coming by and told me that the shop had been so busy.

He, again, assured me that the shop could easily correct the problem. He went on to say, “It’s really a five-minute fix. I could do it now, but I don’t want to just in case something happens and makes it longer than that and throw our day off.”

My appointment was set for Wednesday, July 8th at 9:30am. I used PTO at work so that I could finally get the issue taken care of. The evening before my appointment, Ben called and told me they would have to cancel (not reschedule) my appointment because they didn’t get a chance to finish a car from the previous day. He went on to say that they could probably do it at “some other time” and he’d call me to let me know when. Of course, I was never called.

•Why would you tell your customer that you’re too busy to give them an appointment? Especially when there are others working in the office.

•Why are you making the customer chase you as if this is the only place that could correct the issue?

•I understand that the shop may have been busy, or behind schedule. Why not reschedule my appointment?

•If you did not want to (or could not) perform the work, you should’ve been upfront. It was a waste of both of our time.

This is the second Jimmy’s Car Stereo location I’ve had a poor experience at.

name: It’s me
text: I’m had some work done a couple years ago and it has been great so far. My only gripe is how tight they tightened my positive battery terminal. Long story short, in my attempt to remove the battery, I stripped the terminal and grounded out my wrench simultaneously which caused more problems with the wiring that I had to pay a mechanic to fix. All of this could have been easily avoided if they wouldn’t have tightened it SO TIGHT! Completely unnecessary, especially considering how close the fuse box and the battery are put together which already makes it hard enough to losen. I would have rather used that money I spent on a mechanic at Jimmy’s getting more audio equipment because they have great stuff.
